Logger

Logger

A logging abstraction powered by Bunyan that provides both a default logger configuration that will log to sfdx.log, and a way to create custom loggers based on the same foundation.

Constructor

new Logger(optionsOrName)

See:
  • https://github.com/cwallsfdc/node-bunyan
  • https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.sfdx_dev.meta/sfdx_dev/sfdx_dev_cli_log_messages.htm

Constructs a new Logger.

Examples
// Gets the root sfdx logger
const logger = await Logger.root();
// Creates a child logger of the root sfdx logger with custom fields applied
const childLogger = await Logger.child('myRootChild', {tag: 'value'});
// Creates a custom logger unaffiliated with the root logger
const myCustomLogger = new Logger('myCustomLogger');
// Creates a child of a custom logger unaffiliated with the root logger with custom fields applied
const myCustomChildLogger = myCustomLogger.child('myCustomChild', {tag: 'value'});
Parameters:
Name Type Description
optionsOrName LoggerOptions | string

A set of LoggerOptions or name to use with the default options.

Members

(static) DEFAULT_LEVEL :LoggerLevel

The default LoggerLevel when constructing new Logger instances.

Type:
  • LoggerLevel

(static) LEVEL_NAMES :Array.<string>

See:
  • LoggerLevel

A list of all lower case LoggerLevel names.

Type:
  • Array.<string>

(static) ROOT_NAME :string

See:
  • Logger.root

The name of the root sfdx Logger.

Type:
  • string

Methods

(async, static) child(name, fieldsopt) → {Promise.<Logger>}

Create a child of the root logger, inheriting this instance's configuration such as level, streams, etc.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
name string

The name of the child logger.
fields Fields <optional>

Additional fields included in all log lines.
Returns:
Type
Promise.<Logger>

(static) getLevelByName(levelName)

See:
  • LoggerLevel

Gets a numeric LoggerLevel value by string name.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
levelName string

The level name to convert to a LoggerLevel enum value.
Throws:

{name: 'UnrecognizedLoggerLevelName'}: The level name was not case-insensitively recognized as a valid LoggerLevel value.

Type
SfdxError

(async, static) root() → {Promise.<Logger>}

Gets the root logger with the default level and file stream.

Returns:
Type
Promise.<Logger>

addField(name, value) → {Logger}

Add a field to all log lines for this logger.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the field to add.
value FieldValue

The value of the field to be logged.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Logger

addFilter(filter)

Adds a filter to be applied to all logged messages.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter function

A function with signature (...args: any[]) => any[] that transforms log message arguments.

(async) addLogFileStream(logFile) → {Promise.<void>}

Adds a file stream to this logger.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
logFile string

The path to the log file. If it doesn't exist it will be created.
Returns:

Resolved or rejected upon completion of the addition.

Type
Promise.<void>

addStream(stream, defaultLevelopt)

Adds a stream.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
stream LoggerStream

The stream configuration to add.
defaultLevel LoggerLevelValue <optional>

The default level of the stream.

child(name, fieldsopt) → {Logger}

Create a child logger, typically to add a few log record fields.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
name string

The name of the child logger that is emitted w/ log line as log:<name>.
fields Fields <optional>

Additional fields included in all log lines for the child logger.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Logger

close(fnopt)

Close the logger, including any streams, and remove all listeners.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fn function <optional>

A function with signature (stream: LoggerStream) => void to call for each stream with the stream as an arg.

Logs at debug level with filtering applied.

Name Type Attributes Description
args any <repeatable>

Any number of arguments to be logged.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Logger

Gets an array of log line objects. Each element is an object that corresponds to a log line.

readLogContentsAsText() → {string}

Reads a text blob of all the log lines contained in memory or the log file.

Returns:
Type
string

setLevel(levelopt) → {Logger}

Set the logging level of all streams for this logger. If a specific level is not provided, this method will attempt to read it from the environment variable SFDX_LOG_LEVEL, and if not found, Logger.DEFAULT_LOG_LEVEL will be used instead.

Examples
// Sets the level from the environment or default value
logger.setLevel()
// Set the level from the INFO enum
logger.setLevel(LoggerLevel.INFO)
// Sets the level case-insensitively from a string value
logger.setLevel(Logger.getLevelByName('info'))
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
level LoggerLevelValue <optional>

The logger level.
Throws:

{name: 'UnrecognizedLoggerLevelName'}: A value of level read from SFDX_LOG_LEVEL was invalid.

Type
SfdxError
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Logger

shouldLog(level) → {boolean}

Compares the requested log level with the current log level. Returns true if the requested log level is greater than or equal to the current log level.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
level LoggerLevelValue

The requested log level to compare against the currently set log level.
Returns:
Type
boolean

trace(…args) → {Logger}

Logs at trace level with filtering applied.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
args any <repeatable>

Any number of arguments to be logged.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Logger

useMemoryLogging() → {Logger}

Use in-memory logging for this logger instance instead of any parent streams. Useful for testing.

WARNING: This cannot be undone for this logger instance.

Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Logger

warn(…args) → {Logger}

Logs at warn level with filtering applied.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
args any <repeatable>

Any number of arguments to be logged.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Logger
